intro: Bupleurum exaltatum var. subnivale, commonly known as the snow-flower bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered with a dense layer of silky hairs, giving it a frost-covered appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
